newsitem.title: USA: Tumbleweed Software names Consul as CFP.
newsitem.headline: Tumbleweed Software names Consul as CFP.

text.p: Tumbleweed Software Inc. said it will name on Tuesday Joe Consul, a 12-year veteran of finance and adminstration, as chief financial officer of the Internet document delivery company.

Consul, formerly vice president of operations for Fractal Design Corp., will manage Tumbleweed's second round of venture funding along with Tumbleweed Chief Executive Officer Jeff Smith, the company said.

Tumbleweed had previously raised $3.5 million from investors including Draper Fisher Juvertson, Sofinnova, Bayview Partners, R.R. Donnelley and France Telecom and is currently looking to raise $5 million to $8 million.
Smith said the company has faced strong growth since the recent launch of its flagship product, Posta, which permits secure document delivery over the Internet.
"We required a seasoned finance professional with the ability to manage this growth, direct experience in electronic publishing and an understanding of market dynamics," Smith said in a statement.
Tumbleweed also said it was naming Robert Krauss as vice president of sales and Carol Wang Carpenter to vice president of marketing. ((sam.perry@reuters.com, Palo Alto Bureau 415 846 5400))
